snippet.desc: Attach to an actor to make the camera follow it. You can then specify the speed at which the camera should "scroll" towards the actor.
snippet.description: Attach to an actor to make the camera follow it. You can then specify the speed at which the camera should "scroll" towards the actor.
snippet.name: Camera Follow

number.desc: INTERNAL ATTRIBUTE: The x-position that the camera should be.
number.name: _intendedCameraX

number.desc: INTERNAL ATTRIBUTE: The y-position that the camera should be.
number.name: _intendedCameraY

number.desc: INTERNAL ATTRIBUTE: The current x-position of the camera.
number.name: _currentCameraX

number.desc: INTERNAL ATTRIBUTE: The current y-position of the camera.
number.name: _currentCameraY

number.desc: The speed, in pixels per frame, that the camera should scroll by following the actor. Leave as 0 to indicate an instant jump.
number.name: _ScrollSpeed

snippet.desc: The Health Manager will track the Actor's current health, as well as provide blocks for healing and damaging the Actor. It can also send messages to other behaviors to allow for a wide range of functionality.
snippet.description: The Health Manager will track the Actor's current health, as well as provide blocks for healing and damaging the Actor. It can also send messages to other behaviors to allow for a wide range of functionality.
snippet.name: Health Manager

number.desc: Amount of health to start with.
number.name: _StartingHealth

number.desc: Maximum amount of health.
number.name: _MaximumHealth

number.desc: HIDDEN - Tracks the current amount of health.
number.name: _CurrentHealth

text.desc: Send this message to all behaviors when the Actor is healed by any amount. Remove value to prevent a message from being sent.
text.name: _HealedMessage

text.desc: Send this message to all behaviors when the Actor is damaged by any amount. Remove the value to prevent a message from being sent.
text.name: _DamagedMessage

text.desc:
What should we do when the health reaches zero?
1. Kill Actor
2. Do Nothing
text.name: _ZeroHealthAction

number.desc: How long should the Actor become temporarily invincible after being damaged?
number.name: _DelayBetweenDamage

boolean.desc: Check this box if the Actor's health should persist (stay the same) from scene to scene.
boolean.name: _PersistentHealth

game-attribute.desc:
Note: This option is only used if the Persistent Health? box is checked.

Select a Game Attribute to track the health for this Actor. Make sure the Attribute starts with a value of 0 (zero). Do not use the same attribute for more than one Actor.
game-attribute.name: _HealthGameAttribute

text.desc: INTERNAL ATTRIBUTE: The name of the game attribute created within the behaviour.
text.name: _HealthIdentifier

sound.desc: Play this sound when the Actor is damaged.
sound.name: _DamageSound

sound.desc: Play this sound when the Actor is killed.
sound.name: _DeathSound

sound.desc: Play this sound when the Actor is healed.
sound.name: _HealSound

number.desc: Horizontal offset of the newly spawned actor from the original Actor.
number.name: xOffset

number.desc: Vertical offset of the newly spawned actor from the original Actor.
number.name: yOffset

number.desc: How long should the actor stay alive before disappearing? Leave at 0 to prevent the Actor from being removed.
number.name: lifespan

boolean.desc: Should the actor spawn another actor on death? Useful for death effects such as explosions.
boolean.name: _SpawnActorOnDeath

text.desc: Actor space (relative to upper left coordinate of Actor), or Screen Space (where 0,0 is upper left of screen)?
text.name: _DrawingLocation

number.desc: Horizontal offset in pixels
number.name: _HealthBarXOffset

number.desc: How many pixels should the outline be? Set to 0 to prevent an outline from drawing.
number.name: _HealthBarOutlineSize

number.desc: Vertical offset in pixels
number.name: _HealthBarYOffset

number.desc: In pixels
number.name: _HealthBarWidth

number.desc: In pixels
number.name: _HealthBarHeight

color.desc: Enter an outline colour that will display around the background of the health bar
color.name: _HealthBarOutlineColour

color.desc: Colour of the health bar when the health is over 75%.
color.name: _ColourOver75

color.desc: Colour of the health bar when the health is over 50%.
color.name: _ColourOver50

color.desc: Colour of the health bar when the health is over 25%.
color.name: _ColourOver25

color.desc: Colour of the health bar when the health is under 25%.
color.name: _ColourUnder25

color.desc: Background colour of the health bar.
color.name: _HealthBarBackgroundColour

boolean.desc: Whether a health bar should be drawn or not.
boolean.name: _DrawHealthBar

snippet.desc: Spawn bullets from the actor's position.
snippet.description: Spawn bullets from the actor's position.
snippet.name: Fire Bullet

text.desc:
How to determine the direction of the bullets:

Relative - Treat Direction relative to the actor's orientation.
Absolute - Treat Direction as absolute.
Based on Animations - Determine the direction based on the current animation.
text.dropdown: Relative=Relative Absolute=Absolute Based on Animations=Based on Animations
text.name: _DirectionMode

number.desc: The speed at which the bullets will move.
number.name: _BulletSpeed

actortype.desc: The bullet actor type to create.
actortype.name: _BulletType

number.desc:
The direction in which the bullet will move.
Only used if Direction Mode is Relative or Absolute. If Direction Mode is Based on Animations the following four attributes determine the direction instead.
number.dropdown: North=-90 North East=-45 East=0 South East=45 South=90 South West=135 West=180 North West=-135
number.name: _Direction

number.desc: The offset in the direction of movement at which the bullets will be created.
number.name: _Offset

boolean.desc:
If selected, holding down the Fire Control will fire bullets.

You can also trigger the FireBullet event to fire a bullet.
boolean.name: _UseControls

boolean.desc: If selected, holding down the mouse will fire bullets.
boolean.name: _UsetheMouse

boolean.desc: If selected, no more than <var>Maximum Bullets Alive</var> can be alive at the same time.
boolean.name: _LimitBulletsAlive

number.desc: The maximum number of actors to be alive at the same time. Only used if <var>Limit Bullets Alive</var> is selected.
number.name: _MaximumBulletsAlive

number.desc: The maximum number of bullets created per second.
number.name: _RateOfFire

number.desc:
The maximum ammunition the actor can have.
Only used if Use Ammunition is selected.
number.name: _MaximumAmmunition

number.desc:
The current ammunition the actor has when created.
Only used if Use Ammunition is selected.
Trigger the Reload event to set the current ammunition to the maximum ammunition.
number.name: _CurrentAmmunition

boolean.desc: If selected, the current ammunition will be reduced by one on every shot.
boolean.name: _UseAmmunition

text.desc: Shoot up if the current animation name contains this text.
text.name: _UpAnimations

text.desc: Shoot down if the current animation name contains this text.
text.name: _DownAnimations

text.desc: Shoot left if the current animation name contains this text.
text.name: _LeftAnimations

text.desc: Shoot right if the current animation name contains this text.
text.name: _RightAnimations

snippet.desc: Shows an intro title, which slides away after the specified time.
snippet.description: Shows an intro title, which slides away after the specified time.
snippet.name: Intro Title

boolean.desc: INTERNAL ATTRIBUTE. Whether or not the slide-off has started.
boolean.name: _Started

font.desc: The font to use when drawing the intro title. Specify from the list of fonts you have created in Stencyl.
font.name: _FontToUse

number.desc: The amount of time, in seconds, before that the intro title should wait before beginning its exit of the screen.
number.name: _TimeBeforeRetreat

number.desc: The y-position, in screen coordinates, of the centre of the Intro Title.
number.name: _YCentrePosition

text.desc: Show this text in the Intro Title. Leave blank to use the scene's name.
text.name: _AlternativeText

number.desc: The initial speed to slide off the screen at.
number.name: _SlideSpeed

boolean.desc: Should a rounded rectangle be drawn behind the text?
boolean.name: _DrawRectangle

number.desc: The x-position, in screen coordinates, of the centre of the Intro Title.
number.name: _XCentrePosition

color.desc: The fill colour for the rounded rectangle behind the text, if one is drawn.
color.name: _FillColour

color.desc: The stroke colour for the rounded rectangle behind the text, if one is drawn. (Stroke is the outline).
color.name: _StrokeColour

number.desc: The thickness, in pixels, of the stroke around the outside of the rounded rectangle behind the text, if one is drawn.
number.name: _StrokeThickness

number.desc: Padding around the text, in pixels, for the rounded rectangle behind the text, if one is drawn.
number.name: _Padding

number.desc: The amount the rounded rectangle is rounded, if one is drawn. (Use 0 for right-angled corners).
number.name: _Rounding

text.desc: The direction the Intro Title slides away to.
text.name: _SlideDirection

number.desc: The slide speed is incremented by this value every update.
number.name: _SlideSpeedChange

snippet.desc:
For platformers - an actor will have movement similar to the Goomba from Super Mario Bros - actor will walk back anf forth horizontally, and change direction when colliding with an object.
Just configure the walking animations & speed.
snippet.description:
For platformers - an actor will have movement similar to the Goomba from Super Mario Bros - actor will walk back anf forth horizontally, and change direction when colliding with an object.
Just configure the walking animations & speed.
snippet.name: Enemy Walking AI

snippet.desc: Makes the actor always face a given target actor.
snippet.description: Makes the actor always face a given target actor.
snippet.name: Face Target

number.desc: The facing of the actor's sprite.
number.name: _Facing

actor.desc:
The target actor this actor will be facing.
If the target actor is unset or dead this behavior will do nothing.
actor.name: _TargetActor

snippet.desc: Makes the actor move back and forth horizontally.
snippet.description: Makes the actor move back and forth horizontally.
snippet.name: Back and Forth Horizontally

number.desc: The movement speed.
number.name: _Speed

number.desc: The distance the actor will be moving to the left.
number.name: _DistanceLeft

number.desc: The distance the actor will be moving to the right.
number.name: _DistanceRight

number.desc: The direction in which the actor will be moving when created.
number.name: _InitialDirection

boolean.desc:
If selected, the actor will change the movement direction when colliding.
If unselected, the actor will try to keep on moving in the current direction.
boolean.name: _ChangeDirectiononCollision

boolean.desc: Used to prevent the dialogue from being executed more than once.
boolean.name: _DisplayDialog

list.desc:
Input the message you wish to display. Insert _ for an empty (blank) line of dialogue.
Dialogue must be input like so: Portrait|Message to Display.
Example: Player|So this cave leads to the forbidden city?
list.name: _dialog01

number.desc: # of times to display the message.
number.name: _messageLength

number.desc:
How many lines of dialogue should be displayed per message box?
Default: 4
number.name: _ofLines

number.desc:
If Randomize Dialogue is checked, set this to the number of dialogue lists to use. If Progressive Dialogue is checked, uses this to set the number of dialogue lists used.
MAX = 3
number.name: _ofDialogues

number.desc:
1) No image, fixed size = Do not use a backgound image for the Dialog box, use dimensions specified
2) No image, variable size = Do not use an image, and let the Dialog box shrink/expand based on text
3) Image, fixed size = Use an image, and force the dialog box to that size
4) Image, variable size = Use an image and allow it to shrink/grow based on dimensions specified
number.dropdown: No Image, Fixed Size = 1 No Image, Variable Size = 2 Image, Fixed Size = 3 Image, Variable Size = 4
number.name: DialogBoxMode

number.desc: Dialog box width. Used for Dialog Box modes 1 & 4
number.name: Width

number.desc: Dialog box height. Used for Dialog Box modes 1 & 4
number.name: Height

number.desc: Enter the horizontal offset based on the alignment
number.name: DialogHorizontalOffset

number.desc: Enter the vertical offset based on the alignment
number.name: DialogVerticalOffset

number.desc: Select where you want the dialog box to be aligned
number.dropdown: On Actor = 1 Top Left = 2 Top Right = 3 Bottom Left = 4 Bottom Right = 5 Center = 6 Top Center = 7 Bottom Center = 8
number.name: Alignment

number.desc: Amount of padding to the left of the text
number.name: TextLeftMargin

number.desc: Amount of padding to the right of the text
number.name: TextRightMargin

number.desc: Amount of padding above the text
number.name: TextTopMargin

number.desc: Amount of padding below the text
number.name: TextBottomMargin

actortype.desc:
The image of this actor will be used as the background for the
dialog box if mode 3 or 4 is selected above.
actortype.name: DialogBoxActor

number.desc: Amount of time to fade in / out the dialog box
number.name: FadeTime

boolean.desc: Display the text one character at a time?
boolean.name: UseTypingEffect

number.desc: Delay between each character
number.name: TypingDelay

actortype.desc: Use this image to indicate that there is more text to display
actortype.name: TextOverflowIndicator

number.desc:
By default the overflow image will be placed at the bottom center.
Enter the horizontal offset here.
number.name: OverflowHorizontalOffset

number.desc:
By default the overflow image will be placed at the bottom center.
Enter the verticall offset here.
number.name: OverflowVerticalOffset

actortype.desc: This will be used as the character portrait
actortype.name: PortraitActorType

number.desc:
By default the portrait will display at the top left of the dialog box.
Enter the horizontal offset here
number.name: PortraitHoriztonalOffset

number.desc:
By default the portrait will display at the top left of the dialog box.
Enter the vertical offset here
number.name: PortraitVerticalOffset

sound.desc: Sound to play for each character
sound.name: TypingSound

font.desc: Select the font to use in the Dialog Box
font.name: _Font

color.desc:
If a separate actor is not being used to
represent your dialog box, enter the color
you'd like to use as the default background.
color.name: _DialogBoxColor

number.desc:
Enter a value between 0-100 to specify
where 0 is completely transparent
number.name: _DialogBoxTransparency

sound.desc: Sound to play when opening the Dialog Box
sound.name: _OpenDialogSound

sound.desc:
Sound to play when dislaying the next page
of the Dialog Box
sound.name: _NextPageDialogSound

sound.desc: Sound to play when closing the Dialog Box
sound.name: _CloseDialogSound
